ETYMOLOGY: From Spanish 'cigarro', possibly from Mayan 'sikar' ('to smoke tobacco leaves') or 'sicarra' ('tobacco'). Introduced to English in the late 17th century.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A cylinder of tobacco leaves rolled to be smoked, usually larger than a cigarette.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种由经过发酵和风干的烟叶卷制而成的烟草制品，通常比香烟大，用于吸食。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He celebrated his success by lighting up a fine Cuban cigar.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他通过点燃一支上好的古巴雪茄来庆祝成功。
